Summarise a logistic regression model

info.glm.Rd

Summarize a logistic regression model of class "glm".

# S3 method for glm
info(x)

Arguments

x

an object of class "glm"

Value

The list of class c("info.glm", "list").

omnibus.test

omnibus chisquare test

fit.indices

goodness of fit measures including Stukel's test, Pseudo R-squared, and Akaike Information Criterion

anova.table

Type-III Analysis of Variance Table

coefficient.table

includes Coefficients, Standardized Coefficients, Standard Errors, z-values, and p-values with significant stars

oddsratios

odd's ratios with 95% confidence intervals

N

sample size

target

category predicted

Details

Put details here

See also

Anova, Confint

Examples

fit <- regress(am ~ hp + wt + mpg, mtcars)
info(fit)
#> LOGISTIC REGRESSION SUMMARY 
#> Formula: am ~ hp + wt + mpg
#> Data   : mtcars
#> N      : 32
#> 
#> Predicted category is 1.
#> 
#> Omnibus Test 
#> <U+03A7>²(3) = 34.4636, p = 1.581e-07 ***
#> 
#> Fit Measures 
#> Stukel's Test: p = 0.0125
#> Tjura's Psuedo-R²:0.8216
#> AIC: 16.7661 
#> 
#> Anova Table (type III tests) 
#>     LR Chisq DF Pr(>Chisq)   
#> hp     8.418  1   0.003715 **
#> wt    10.466  1   0.001216 **
#> mpg    1.293  1   0.255496   
#> 
#> Logistic Regression Coefficients 
#>                     B       SE       z Pr(>|z|)  
#> (Intercept) -15.72137 40.00281 -0.3930  0.69431  
#> hp            0.08389  0.08228  1.0196  0.30790  
#> wt           -6.95492  3.35297 -2.0743  0.03806 *
#> mpg           1.22930  1.58109  0.7775  0.43686  
#> 
#> Odds Ratios (with 95% Confidence Intervals) 
#>     Odds Ratio      2.5%     97.5%
#> hp   1.0875130 1.014e+00    1.5532
#> wt   0.0009539 1.002e-08    0.1163
#> mpg  3.4188427 6.195e-01 1710.0900
